issue.title: [Python] chunked array not iterable, not indexable
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-2287](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-2287). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
It would be useful to access individual elements of a chunked array either through iteration or indexing.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-2287?focusedCommentId=16389542) by Uwe Korn (uwe):*
This is partly addressed in https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/1702

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-2287?focusedCommentId=16500489) by Krisztian Szucs (kszucs):*
`[~xhochy]` What has left from this ticket?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-2287?focusedCommentId=16500503) by Uwe Korn (uwe):*
It would be nice if one could iterate in Python value-for-value over this. At the moment you could already approximate that using

```Java

for i in range(len(chunked_array)):
    val = chunked_array[i]
```

Not sure if we really need to have more comfort.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-2287?focusedCommentId=16504581) by Uwe Korn (uwe):*
